intro: Eleutherococcus simonii var. simonii, commonly known as Siberian ginseng, is a deciduous shrub native to the forests of eastern Russia, China, and Korea. It belongs to the family Apiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in late summer. The plant produces dark red berries that are rich in antioxidants and have been used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded woodland environments. Its adaptability to cold climates makes it a hardy and resilient plant in temperate regions.
